headline: Previewing Q2 Earnings Expectations
summary: The current expectation is for Q2 earnings to increase by +5.1% on +3.8% higher revenues YoY, which will be a material deceleration from the +11.9% earnings growth pace in Q1 on +3.6% higher revenues. What else should investors know?

headline: Why Oracle Rallied Today for the Second Day in a Row
summary: Following Wednesday's earnings beat and Thursday's move higher, Oracle was upgraded by Wall Street analysts today.  Shares of tech giant Oracle (NYSE: ORCL) rallied another 7.8% on Friday, even as the broader Nasdaq Composite was down 1.3% on the day.  In Wednesday's fiscal fourth-quarter 2025 report, Oracle posted 11% revenue growth to $15.9 billion, while adjusted (non-GAAP) earnings per share (EPS) rose a more modest 4.3%.

raw.headline: Why Oracle Rallied Today for the Second Day in a Row

In Wednesday's fiscal fourth-quarter 2025 report, Oracle posted 11% revenue growth to $15.9 billion, while adjusted (non-GAAP) earnings per share (EPS) rose a more modest 4.3%.

summary: Recent announcements from Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) underscore its collaboration with TakeUp, Seekr, and AMD to enhance AI capabilities and performance. headline: Whirlpool upgrade, Chime slides post-IPO, Oracle's new highs
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Bank of America Securities analysts upgrading Whirlpool's (WHR) stock to a Neutral rating, Chime Financial (CHYM) shares sliding in its first full day of trading since making its public debut Thursday, and Oracle stock (ORCL) extending gains to an all time high after releasing fiscal fourth quarter earnings results this week. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Oracle reports Q4 beat, BioNTech to acquire CureVac: Morning Buzz
summary: The major averages were mixed near noon with the Dow the laggard as a pullback in Boeing weighs on the Industrials index. U.S. initial jobless claims were unchanged at 248,000 in the week ended June 7, above expectations and holding at an eight-month high. Geopolitical concerns have also resurfaced; escalating tensions in the Middle East led to a sharp rise in oil prices and triggered safe-haven flows, which weighed on equities and the U.S. dollar. Meanwhile, U.S.-China trade progress continues

headline: BMO upgrades Oracle, sees double-digit income growth despite higher spending
summary: Investing.com -- BMO Capital Markets upgraded Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) to Outperform from Market Perform and raised its price target to $235, pointing to stronger software growth and higher operating income through fiscal 2027, even as capital spending rises.

headline: Nvidia Stock Falls. What’s Behind the Latest Drop.
summary: Nvidia  stock fell early Friday, mirroring losses in the broader market.  CEO Jensen Huang this week announced a flurry of initiatives during his European tour that could strengthen the chip maker’s position in the long run.  Shares dropped 1.3% to $143.15 in early trading Friday, while the  Nasdaq Composite  and  indexes fell 0.8% and 0.7%, respectively, after Israel launched a wide-ranging attack on Iran overnight, putting investors in a risk-off mode.

raw.headline: Nvidia Stock Falls. What’s Behind the Latest Drop.
raw.summary: Nvidia  stock fell early Friday, mirroring losses in the broader market.  CEO Jensen Huang this week announced a flurry of initiatives during his European tour that could strengthen the chip maker’s position in the long run.  Shares dropped 1.3% to $143.15 in early trading Friday, while the  Nasdaq Composite  and  indexes fell 0.8% and 0.7%, respectively, after Israel launched a wide-ranging attack on Iran overnight, putting investors in a risk-off mode.
